001package net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns;
002
003import java.lang.annotation.*;
004
005/**
006 * Indicates that the annotated type or member is a {@code Marker Interface} pattern.
007 * <p>
008 * A <em>marker interface</em> (also known as a tagging interface) is an interface
009 * with no methods, used to "tag" or "mark" a class or component as having a
010 * particular semantic role. The presence of the marker is then detected by
011 * frameworks, tools, or reflection logic to enable special behavior without
012 * modifying the existing code.
013 * </p>
014 *
015 * <p>Examples in the Java standard library include:
016 * <ul>
017 *   <li>{@link java.io.Serializable} — marks a class as capable of being serialized</li>
018 *   <li>{@link java.lang.Cloneable} — marks a class as supporting {@code Object.clone()}</li>
019 *   <li>{@link java.rmi.Remote} — marks a class as usable for remote method invocation</li>
020 * </ul>
021 * </p>
022 *
023 * <p>
024 * This annotation belongs to the {@link DesignPattern.Category#EXTENSIBILITY EXTENSIBILITY}
025 * category, since marker interfaces provide a lightweight mechanism for systems to
026 * be extended, customized, or configured without altering the code of the marked class.
027 * </p>
028 *
029 * <p>Intended usage:
030 * <ul>
031 *   <li>On an interface that is designed to serve as a marker interface</li>
032 *   <li>Optionally on methods or constructors when a framework uses markers on call sites</li>
033 * </ul>
034 * </p>
035 *
036 * @see java.io.Serializable
037 * @see java.lang.Cloneable
038 * @see java.rmi.Remote
039 */
040@Documented
041@DesignPattern(DesignPattern.Category.EXTENSIBILITY)
042@Retention(RetentionPolicy.SOURCE)
043@Target({ElementType.TYPE, ElementType.METHOD, ElementType.CONSTRUCTOR})
044public @interface MarkerInterface {
045
046}
